parameters.name: word

parameters.name: includeDuplicates
parameters.description: Show duplicate examples from different sources

parameters.name: contentProvider
parameters.description: Return results from a specific ContentProvider

parameters.name: useCanonical
parameters.description: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

parameters.description: If true will try to return a correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

operations.summary: Returns other forms of a word

parameters.name: word
parameters.description: String value of WordObject to return

parameters.name: useCanonical
parameters.description: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

parameters.name: includeSuggestions
parameters.description: Return suggestions (for correct spelling, case variants, etc.)

operations.summary: Given a word as a string, returns the WordObject that represents it

parameters.name: word
parameters.description: Word to return definitions for

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return

parameters.name: partOfSpeech
parameters.description: CSV list of part-of-speech types

parameters.name: includeRelated
parameters.description: Return related words with definitions

parameters.name: sourceDictionaries
parameters.description: If 'all' is received, results are returned from all sources. If multiple values are received (e.g. 'century,wiktionary'), results are returned from the first specified dictionary that has definitions. If left blank, results are returned from the first dictionary that has definitions. By default, dictionaries are searched in this order: ahd, wiktionary, webster, century, wordnet

parameters.name: useCanonical
parameters.description: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

parameters.name: includeTags
parameters.description: Return a closed set of XML tags in response

parameters.description: If true will try to return the correct word root ('cats' -> 'cat'). If false returns exactly what was requested.

operations.summary: Fetches audio metadata for a word.
operations.notes: The metadata includes a time-expiring fileUrl which allows reading the audio file directly from the API.  Currently only audio pronunciations from the American Heritage Dictionary in mp3 format are supported.
